recipes.name: Asian Style Egg Fried Rice Recipe
directions: Beat the eggs in a small bowl and season with a pinch of salt.
Make sure the rice is cold and break up any clumps.
Chop all vegetables and have them ready.
Heat 1 tablespoon of vegetable oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat.
Add the beaten eggs and cook, stirring occasionally, until they are just set. Remove the eggs from the pan and set aside.
In the same skillet or wok, add the remaining 1 tablespoon of vegetable oil.
Add the chopped onion, garlic, and grated ginger (if using). Sauté until the onion becomes translucent and the garlic is fragrant, about 2-3 minutes.
Add the peas and carrots to the skillet and cook for another 2-3 minutes, until they are tender.
Increase the heat to high. Add the cold cooked rice to the skillet, breaking up any remaining clumps.
Stir-fry the rice with the vegetables, ensuring it gets well mixed and heated through.
Pour the soy sauce, oyster sauce (if using), and sesame oil over the rice.
Stir well to evenly distribute the sauces. Taste and adjust seasoning with salt and pepper as needed.
Add the cooked eggs back into the skillet, breaking them up into smaller pieces as you mix them in.
Stir in the chopped green onions.
Serve the fried rice hot, garnished with additional green onions if desired.

recipes.name: Chicken and Rice
ingredients: 4 to 6 bone-in, skin on chicken thighs (about 6 ounces each)
Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
4 medium carrots (about 12 ounces), sliced into 1/4-inch rounds
2 teaspoons finely grated lemon zest plus 1 tablespoon lemon juice
directions: Heat 1 tablespoon of the oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Toss the chicken with the paprika, 1 teaspoon salt and a few grinds of pepper in a large bowl.
Place the chicken skin-side down in the skillet and cook undisturbed until the skin is golden but not too dark, 4 to 5 minutes.
Remove the chicken to a plate using a metal spatula and add the remaining 1 tablespoon oil to the skillet.
Add the carrots, celery and shallots to the skillet and cook, stirring occasionally, until softened but not yet turning golden, 4 to 5 minutes.
Stir in the garlic, thyme, oregano, lemon zest, lemon juice, 1/2 teaspoon salt and a few grinds of pepper and cook just until you begin to smell the garlic, about 1 minute.
Stir in the rice and cook undisturbed until lightly toasted, about 2 minutes.
Pour in the stock, add 1/2 teaspoon salt and stir to combine, then add the chicken thighs back to the pan, skin-side up.
Bring the liquid to a boil then cover, reduce the heat to a simmer and cook until the rice is tender and the chicken is cooked through, 15 to 20 minutes.
Meanwhile, preheat the broiler.
Remove the lid from the pan and broil until the chicken skin is crispy and golden, 2 to 3 minutes.
Sprinkle with the chives.

recipes.name: Minced Beef Fried Rice
directions: Heat 1 tablespoon of vegetable oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat.
Add the ground beef and cook until browned, breaking it up with a spoon, about 5-7 minutes. Drain any excess fat.
Add the chopped onion and garlic, and sauté until the onion becomes translucent and the garlic is fragrant, about 2-3 minutes.
Add the peas and carrots to the skillet and cook for another 2-3 minutes, until they are tender.
Increase the heat to high. Add the cold cooked rice to the skillet, breaking up any remaining clumps.
Stir-fry the rice with the beef and vegetables, ensuring it gets well mixed and heated through.
Pour the soy sauce, oyster sauce (if using), and sesame oil over the rice.
Stir well to evenly distribute the sauces. Taste and adjust seasoning with salt and pepper as needed.
Push the rice mixture to one side of the skillet and add the beaten eggs to the empty side. Scramble the eggs until they are just set, then mix them into the rice.
Stir in the chopped green onions.
Serve the minced beef fried rice hot, garnished with additional green onions if desired.

recipes.name: Paprika Chicken and Rice Bake
directions: Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
Season the chicken thighs with smoked paprika, salt, and pepper.
Heat the olive oil in a large oven-safe skillet over medium-high heat.
Sear the chicken thighs, skin side down, until golden brown, about 5 minutes per side. Remove the chicken and set aside.
In the same skillet, add the chopped onion and garlic. Sauté until the onion is translucent and the garlic is fragrant, about 2-3 minutes.
Stir in the rice, chicken broth, diced tomatoes, and dried thyme. Bring to a simmer.
Return the chicken thighs to the skillet, placing them on top of the rice mixture.
Cover the skillet with a lid or aluminum foil and bake in the preheated oven for 25 minutes.
Remove the cover, stir in the frozen peas, and bake uncovered for an additional 10 minutes, or until the rice is tender and the chicken is fully cooked.
Garnish with chopped fresh parsley before serving.

recipes.name: Teriyaki Chicken Fried Rice Dome
ingredients: 1 pound boneless, skinless chicken thighs, cut into bite-sized pieces
1 cup mixed vegetables (peas, carrots, corn), thawed
directions: Heat 1 tablespoon of vegetable oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat.
Add the chicken pieces and cook until they are browned and cooked through, about 5-7 minutes.
Pour the teriyaki sauce over the chicken and stir to coat. Remove the chicken from the pan and set aside.
In the same skillet, add the remaining 1 tablespoon of vegetable oil.
Add the chopped onion and garlic, and sauté until the onion becomes translucent and the garlic is fragrant, about 2-3 minutes.
Add the mixed vegetables and cook for another 2-3 minutes, until they are tender.
Increase the heat to high. Add the cold cooked rice to the skillet, breaking up any remaining clumps.
Stir-fry the rice with the vegetables, ensuring it gets well mixed and heated through.
Pour the soy sauce and sesame oil over the rice. Stir well to evenly distribute the sauces.
Push the rice mixture to one side of the skillet and add the beaten eggs to the empty side. Scramble the eggs until they are just set, then mix them into the rice.
Return the teriyaki chicken to the skillet and stir to combine with the rice mixture.
Shape the fried rice into a dome shape in the skillet and let it cook undisturbed for 1-2 minutes to form a slight crust.
Serve the teriyaki chicken fried rice dome hot, garnished with chopped green onions.

recipes.name: Korean BBQ Rice Bowl
ingredients: 1 pound thinly sliced beef (such as ribeye or sirloin)
directions: In a bowl, combine the soy sauce, brown sugar, sesame oil, garlic, ginger, gochujang, and rice vinegar.
Add the sliced beef to the bowl and marinate for at least 30 minutes.
Heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add the marinated beef and cook until it is browned and cooked through, about 5-7 minutes.
Divide the cooked rice among four bowls.
Top each bowl with the cooked beef, kimchi, cucumber slices, carrot julienne, and green onions.
Sprinkle with sesame seeds before serving.

recipes.name: Chicken Bulgogi Rice Bowl
ingredients: 1 pound boneless, skinless chicken thighs, thinly sliced
1 cup mixed vegetables (such as bell peppers, carrots, and zucchini), thinly sliced
directions: In a bowl, combine the soy sauce, brown sugar, sesame oil, garlic, ginger, gochujang, and rice vinegar.
Add the sliced chicken to the bowl and marinate for at least 30 minutes.
Heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add the marinated chicken and cook until it is browned and cooked through, about 5-7 minutes.
Divide the cooked rice among four bowls.
Top each bowl with the cooked chicken and mixed vegetables.
Sprinkle with green onions and sesame seeds before serving.

recipes.name: Fire Chicken Rice Bowl
ingredients: 1 pound boneless, skinless chicken thighs, cut into bite-sized pieces
1 cup mixed vegetables (such as bell peppers, onions, and zucchini), thinly sliced
directions: In a bowl, combine the gochujang, soy sauce, honey, sesame oil, garlic, and ginger.
Add the chicken pieces to the bowl and marinate for at least 30 minutes.
Heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add the marinated chicken and cook until it is browned and cooked through, about 5-7 minutes.
Add the mixed vegetables to the skillet and cook for another 2-3 minutes, until they are tender.
Divide the cooked rice among four bowls.
Top each bowl with the fire chicken and vegetables.
Sprinkle with green onions and sesame seeds before serving.
